justification: “Eco-guilt was assessed on a 5-item measure originally developed by Mallett (2012) and adapted by Moore and Yang (2020) (42,44).”
“We measured intention to engage in seven pro-climate civic actions in the next year … (Cronbach's alpha = 0.90, see SI.1 part 6).”

measured_by: Swim & Geiger (2017) single-item climate concern measure
justification: “Most people … identified as either concerned or alarmed about climate change on Swim and Geiger's (2017) single-item self-assessment of climate concern.”
“We additionally measured climate worry on a 5-point scale (1 = not at all worried … 5 = very worried) as this was a more sensitive measure in pilot studies.”

measured_by: Perceived Mitigation Responsibility questionnaire for consumers, companies, and governments
justification: “We measured perceived mitigation responsibilities for various groups of people and organizations (see SI.1 part 7).”

measured_by: Real monetary allocation task (slider $0–$100 toward Gold Standard offsets)
justification: “Participants … indicated how much of $100 they would like to allocate to carbon offsets … This was a real behavioral measure of climate action.”
